title: Tester with Workday
description:
```Job Overview:  
We are seeking a skilled Tester to join our team. As a Tester, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and functionality of our software products. This is a critical role that requires attention to detail, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.

Responsibilities:  
- Conduct thorough testing of software applications to identify defects and ensure they meet quality standards  
- Develop and execute test cases, test scripts, and test plans  
- Collaborate with software developers and business analysts to understand requirements and user stories  
- Perform functional, regression, integration, and performance testing  
- Identify and report bugs and issues using bug tracking tools such as Jira  
- Participate in agile development processes, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives  
- Provide feedback on usability and user experience  
- Document test results and create comprehensive test reports

Experience:  
- Proven experience in software testing or quality assurance roles  
- Strong knowledge of software testing methodologies, tools, and processes  
- Proficiency in programming languages such as Java or C  
- Experience with iOS testing is a plus  
- Familiarity with testing frameworks such as JUnit or TestNG  
- Knowledge of software development lifecycle (SDLC) principles  
- Understanding of business analysis concepts and practices  
- Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment  
- Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail

Location: [LOCATION]

Join our team of dedicated professionals who are passionate about delivering high-quality software solutions. We offer competitive salaries, opportunities for career growth, and a supportive work environment. Apply now to become part of our dynamic team!

Note: Please do not include any contact information in your application.```

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $61.10 - $73.58 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Work Location: Remote

title: AWS Developer
description:
About Telestream


For over 25 years, Telestream has been the undisputed trailblazer of innovation in the digital video industry. We craft cutting edge solutions for every facet of media processing and workflow orchestration. Whether it's the adrenaline-pumping live capture, seamless streaming, awe-inspiring production, or meticulous quality assurance of video content - Telestream stands as the unyielding force that ensures your video reaches audiences flawlessly, no matter how they are created, disseminated, or consumed.

  

Our roster of customers include most of the top Media & Entertainment, Video Production, Broadcasting and streaming companies in the world.

  

Now is the time for the next phase of Telestream's growth as we help our customers move to the next generation of video products and solutions that not only take advantage of traditional on premises solutions but are now moving to more hybrid and cloud based technologies and business solutions, while also incorporating AI into their video workflows.

 **AWS Developer - Remote, USA**

  

We are currently looking to hire an AWS developer who will play a crucial role in building scalable, secure, and cost-effective cloud solutions using AWS services and features . If you're passionate about cloud technology and software development, this career path offers exciting challenges.

 **Responsibilities:**

* design cloud-based infrastructure
* monitor and troubleshoot
* facilitate root cause analysis to identify and fix issues that may arise
* ensure reliable monitoring systems to maintain health of platform and reduce downtime
* participate in on call rotation with any customer escalations that arise
* Strive to improve efficiency and sustainability by developing and implementing policies, standards and procedures for the work performed
* Communicate technical information to technical and non-technical staff across the organization and with customers

 **Qualifications:**

* BSc in Computer Science or equivalent
* Proficiency in programming language C#
* Hands-on experience with one or more public cloud providers as we deploy in all environments (AWS required) - (EC2, AWS Networking)
* strong background with SQL
* excellent communicator with the ability to deal with a wide range of internal and external resources
* self sufficient individual who possesses initiative to make decisions and solve a variety of technical issues
* Windows & Linux OS experience

title: Solution Delivery Associate
description:
Are you looking for a company where you will be an integral member of an engineering team focused on delivering cutting edge solutions? Would you like to make a noticeable and direct impact? Do you have a passion for technology, the environment and making the world a better place?


Kitu Systems has assembled a group of talented individuals who are working together to create robust and scalable IoT software, platforms, and applications connecting intelligent energy. We have a “do the right thing” attitude when it comes to the planet, our customers, and our teammates. For our employees, Kitu is not just a job or paycheck, but rather it is a place where we can grow together and make a real difference.

 **About the Role**


Kitu Systems is scaling rapidly and needs your help to define and build our future. We are looking for dedicated, creative individuals to architect and deliver solutions to catalyst visibility, observability, and reliability across our product teams. In this position you will be an integral member of a technical team focused on delivering cutting-edge solutions to a broad range of both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

**What You Will Be Doing**

* Troubleshoot complex issues quickly and effectively. When field systems go down, you will be a member of the team responsible for owning the outage across its lifecycle, from remediation to postmortem.
* Provide technical support to customers during the implementation and post-sales stage. Help troubleshoot issues and debug code to ensure smooth deployment and operation of solutions.
* Contribute to creation and maintenance of technical documentation for accurate records of project activities, issues, and resolutions.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, project managers, and business analysts to gather requirements and ensure alignment between objectives and technical solutions.
 **Basic Qualifications**

* 0-1 year(s) of experience
* Strong project and time management abilities
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and build positive relationships with colleagues
* Strong problem-solving abilities and analytical skills
* Familiarity with technical concepts (cli, scripting, networking concepts)
 **Preferred Qualifications**

* Familiarity with version control
* Familiarity with Agile/SCRUM
* Familiarity with AWS or other cloud providers
 **What We Offer**

* Remote flexible
* Competitive salary + equity
* Rapid growth opportunities
* Generous PTO, healthcare, dental, vision
* 401K
 **Please** **note**

* Candidate Must be a US Citizen/ Green Card Holder
* US candidates only please
* No third-party candidates
* No Visa sponsorship
 **Diversity, Inclusion and Equal Opportunity**


Kitu Systems values our employees and recognizes that all individuals have the ability to make an impact. We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind. Kitu is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Kitu Systems are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, creed, religion or belief, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, family or parental status, or any other legally protected status.

 **About Kitu Systems**


Kitu Systems solves complex information and communication technology challenges to enable the distributed, interconnected, and intelligent energy network of the future. Our solutions address distributed energy resources, including solar generation and battery storage, as well as electric vehicle charging infrastructure and vehicle-to-grid connectivity. Kitu Systems provides robust and scalable IoT software, platforms, and applications connecting intelligent energy. Our entire portfolio is based on open standards, providing ease of integration, architecture flexibility, and interoperability across multiple physical and logical layers without compromising on security. Our customers include utilities, enterprises, smart device manufacturers, and automotive companies. We partner with industry leaders in the fields of DER management, EV supply equipment, and cloud technologies to deliver cost-effective and reliable turnkey solutions to our customers.

title: Senior Technical Content Developer - Support
description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.


This **Senior** **Technical Content Developer** **- Support** role will be responsible for designing and developing product and process training for internal Technical Support audiences. This role will focus on all phases of the training design and development cycle (analysis, design, development, delivery, and evaluation) and requires strong project management skills. This role will play a pivotal part in Snowflake's overall Support learning strategy, contributing to the effective development of Support employees technical and customer service skills.


**RESPONSIBILITIES**:


* Design and develop innovative learning solutions applying adult learning principles and systematic instructional design to create content that fits the learner's needs ensuring performance-based learning outcomes (includes online, classroom, virtual instructor-led training, and blended learning content).
* Lead the creation and distribution of internal technical courseware at Snowflake, including developing exercises, tutorials, job aids, assessments, and other learning methods, including social or connected learning strategies and multimedia-based assets.
* Develop hands-on labs, data generators, and grading applications; build and maintain lab server environments.
* Collaborate effectively with key stakeholders and subject matter experts to understand the needs of our partners, customers, and employees to develop internal training.
* Translate complex technical concepts and components into accurate and impactful visual aids.
* Scope internal training development projects, estimate the time required accurately, manage and report on progress, and employ leadership skills to drive projects to successful completion aligned with plans.
* Manage multiple concurrent projects and consult widely across organizations to determine objectives; locate all information needed to develop courses; when obstacles arise, communicate promptly.
* Utilize subject matter expert time efficiently after first pursuing answers independently; build solid relationships with colleagues across organizations.
* Ensure learning and performance objectives are practical and tailored to the learner and that the training materials meet performance objectives.


**PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:**


* Minimum of a bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Data Systems, Technical Communication or Technical Training
* 8+ years of training curriculum design and development experience (including designing technical training for various modalities such as hands-on labs, eLearning, videos, ILTs, etc.).
* Ability to conduct Train the Trainer sessions for Instructor-Led training content
* Over 3 years of hands-on experience with major cloud provider services (AWS, Azure, GCP), and in SQL programming, and database systems.
* Proficient in core concepts like Cloud Deployment, Infrastructure, system architecture, Linux CLI, computer networking, and distributed systems.
* Knowledge of data-driven technologies, including Database/SQL, ETL, data pipeline, Snowflake, AI, and ML.
* Direct experience with instructional design models such as ADDIE, Bloom, Gagne, SAM, etc.
* Professional experience using elearning software (Articulate, Captivate, or similar) and LMS (Cornerstone, Workday, or similar).
* Demonstrated hands-on experience of elearning and video editing tools, such as Articulate, Captivate, Camtasia, Final Cut, Adobe Premiere, and After Effects,
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, including skills in collaborating with subject matter experts and managers to help design and develop training.
* High aptitude for managing and solving tactical issues.
* Outstanding problem-solver, negotiator, diversity advocate, and relationship-builder.
* Able to grasp and convey the highly technical subject matter. Certification from AWS, Snowflake, or other cloud vendors preferred
* Excellent time management skills with the ability to coordinate and prioritize effectively.
* Able to work in a dynamic, ever-changing environment with a sense of urgency.

title: Lab Developer
description:
**Description**


Skillable is a 100% remote and virtual tech company that’s modernizing the world of training. Come share your professional magic with highly talented, drive and fun colleagues who believe in the power of “skilling.” Experience what a true team focused on doing the right thing feels like!  

Our people and talent are what make us great and fun! We work together to create amazing solutions and experiences for our customers and their clients. We utilize our employees’ personal strengths to help our company grow and ensure our team is living their best, authentic life. We don’t just share our appreciation for our team members once a year with a branded mug—it’s shared on a daily basis. Our remote work environment blends the demands of work and life without the added pressure of commuting or feeling guilty about leaving early to visit the dentist.  

Come work with us and learn what teamwork and integrity blended with an emphasis on well-being and balance can do for your career!  

The **Lab Developer** will work as a specialist to support our Challenges team by working directly within Skillable’s lab platform to resolve and update lab environment and/or instructions, which includes extensive scripting (PowerShell and Bash) required for validation exercises. They will support the creation of high-quality lab content and suggest improvements toward publishing hands-on labs that are on-time and on-budget. Additionally, this person will be responsible for assessing lab quality through step-by-step testing. **Responsibilities*** Take guidance and instructions from lab authors and SMEs to build hands-on labs to our standards focused on customer needs and satisfaction.
* Work day-to-day with the Lab Development group to consistently refine and accelerate our development process to ensure high quality standards balanced with consistent margins.
* During technical content reviews (QA), identify errors such as Markdown formatting errors, steps that do not align to the user experience, and content flow.
* Troubleshoot errors to determine whether they exist due to input error vs UI changes/broken lab steps.
* As required, record lab step updates to include instructions, UI changes, and screenshots in provided lab test spreadsheet and work with internal lab developers to resolve, and/or update instructions and report blocking issues.
* Collaborate with internal lab development stakeholders and customers to build virtualized environments with supporting learning instructions that meet identified requirements, provide verification that tasks are challenge centric.
* Write PowerShell/BASH scripts to deploy and score labs as needed and use the specific features of the platform to create the best learner experience.
* When working as part of a customer project, communicate and follow-up with customers throughout the product development lifecycle, proactively identifying and eliminating situations deviating from best practices.
* Maintain a proactive and open line of communication with the project team for all content efforts.
* Stay up-to-date and proactively learn about updated and new technologies.
* Understand the products and solutions offered by Skillable and as needed, advise on solutions during customer conversations.
* Utilize automated lab and courseware publishing process to manage and deploy content.
* Work with Instructional Designers to develop professional hands-on experiences.
* Determine services and features to be included in hands-on experiences, based on intended audience profile, learning objectives, best practices, and strategic initiatives.
* Collaborate with Subject Matter Experts (including Curriculum Developers, Technical Trainers, Support Engineers, Professional Services, and Solutions Architects) to build technically accurate training that meets the learning objectives.
* Support and promote the company values through positive interactions with both internal and external stakeholders on a regular basis.
* Other strategic business initiatives or special cross-functional project involvement as required.

**Requirements**


* Bachelor’s degree in related field (computer science, etc) or relevant professional experience
* 4+ years of experience in a technical environment that can be a combination of positions such as: Lab Development, Systems Administration, Systems Automation, and/or Support Engineering
* Experience using PowerShell to query endpoints or automate solutions.
* Preferred experience using Bash and Python to query endpoints or automate solutions.
* Experience using CSS and JavaScript a plus.
* Technical skills across a broad range of cloud and on-premises platforms, including experience with Microsoft Azure, AWS, VMware, Hyper-V, Linux, and Docker. Working knowledge of Google Cloud Platform and others is helpful.
* Proven technical skills implementing, administering, and automating cloud and on-premises platforms and services using PowerShell, BASH, CLIs, and related scripting. Experience in DevOps and related disciplines highly desired.
* Ability and willingness to participate in multiple technical projects concurrently.
* Desire and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
* Experience developing training curriculum, training aides, and other self-paced or instructor led training content is a substantial benefit.

**Salary Range**  

The base salary for this position is $60,000 - $85,000 annually. Consistent with applicable laws, compensation will be determined based on the candidate's level, relevant skills, qualifications, and experience along with requirements for the position and annual financial plans.  

Skillable is a distributed first team with employees working across the U.S., and we do not consider geography when determining compensation ranges.  

Please note that it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range. Skillable reserves the right to modify this compensation range at any time. **Working Conditions**  

The job conditions for this position are in a remote home office setting, requiring a space that supports privacy and focus to attend to regular and frequent video and voice calls. Employees in this position use PC and phone on an on-going basis throughout the day. Travel is anticipated up to 10% of the time for critical business meetings and industry events.

title: Scala Software Developer
description:
We are a dynamic startup at the forefront of financial technology, dedicated to simplifying the complex world of trading and taxation. Our cloud-based software solution empowers traders and tax professionals to efficiently manage tax reporting, navigate the intricacies of wash sales, and streamline the tax filing process. As we continue to innovate and expand our offerings, we're looking for a talented Scala Developer to join our team. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to a product that makes a real difference in the financial and tax planning sector, with the added benefit of equity opportunities as your tenure and impact grow.

Role:

As a part-time Scala Developer with our company, you will leverage your expertise to enhance and expand our cloud-based platform. You will work alongside a dedicated team of developers and product managers to deliver features that meet the specific needs of traders and tax professionals. Your contributions will directly influence the efficiency and effectiveness of our users' tax management processes.

Responsibilities:

* Design, develop, and refine features of our cloud-based software, focusing on scalability, security, and user experience.
* Collaborate with the product team to understand user needs and translate them into robust software solutions.
* Implement solutions for complex tax reporting and wash sale scenarios, ensuring accuracy and compliance with regulatory standards.
* Contribute to the agile development process, including sprint planning, code reviews, and retrospectives.
* Stay abreast of developments in tax legislation and financial regulations that may impact our software and users.

Required Skills and Experience:

* Proficiency in Scala and Java Technologies, with a strong foundation in functional programming principles.
* Experience in developing cloud-based software solutions, with a focus on security and data protection.
* Familiarity with financial markets, trading, or tax reporting is a plus but not required.
* Proven ability to work in a fast-paced, agile environment.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with a proactive approach to identifying and resolving potential issues.

Compensation and Growth Opportunities:

* Competitive part-time salary, with a commitment of 20 hours per month.
* Significant equity opportunities, reflecting our belief in rewarding those who contribute to our growth and success.
* Flexible working hours and remote work, accommodating your needs and preferences.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development within a rapidly evolving fintech space.

How to Apply:

If you're passionate about leveraging technology to solve complex problems in the trading and tax domains, we'd love to hear from you. Please send your resume, a brief cover letter explaining your interest and suitability for the role, and any relevant project examples or GitHub links to hello@traderfyles.com. Join us in transforming the landscape of financial technology and tax management.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $20,000.00 - $112,624.70 per year

Expected hours: 10 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

Compensation package:

* 1099 contract
* RSU

Experience level:

* 2 years

Work Location: Remote

title: Architect Secure Cloud
description:
At Alcon, we are driven by the meaningful work we do to help people see brilliantly. We innovate boldly, champion progress, and act with speed as the global leader in eye care. Here, you’ll be recognized for your dedication and contributions and see your career like never before. Together, we go above and beyond to make an impact in the lives of our patients and customers.
We foster an inclusive culture and are looking for diverse, talented people to join Alcon. As the Cloud Security Architect, you will play a critical role in the design, implementation, governance, and maintenance of secure cloud-based infrastructures for our organization. Applying your expertise in cloud security practices, knowledge of industry standards, and hands-on experience with various cloud platforms will be essential in safeguarding our critical data, applications, and systems from potential threats and vulnerabilities. This role will collaborate with multi-functional teams, including developers, operations, vulnerability management, and infrastructure to represent IT security, ensuring the perfect integration of security measures throughout the cloud environment. In this position you will use significant learning agility and thrive on crafting solutions with a distributed team in a dynamic environment in the United States (Remote)!
Objectives:* Provide leadership to IT and the business on information security and serve as domain expert and principal designer for information security topics across multiple areas of specialization, including cloud technologies.
* Lead a team of security and IT specialists and ensuring the best security practice implementations.
* Develop and drive implementation of the strategic security vision with IT Management for areas of responsibility.
* Analyze the current IT security environment to detect critical deficiencies and researches/evaluates alternative solutions while weighing costs, efficiencies, and industry standard methodologies to provide recommended solution.


Key Responsibilities:* Develop and maintain a comprehensive cloud security strategy aligned with the organization's overall security objectives. Assess existing security measures and propose improvements to strengthen the security posture of the cloud environment.
* Collaborate with solution architects to craft secure and scalable cloud infrastructures that meet the organization's needs. Ensure that security requirements are coordinated into the cloud architecture from the beginning.
* Collaborate with relevant partners to ensure aligned implementations of corrective actions and broader security solutions are strategically and technologically aligned across multiple domains.
* Analyze the current Security IT environment to find opportunities or security solutions to the business within each area of responsibility.
* Advise on secure architecture/design (reference architectures), attack surface area reduction, the least privileged design, threat mitigations, and security standard methodologies.
* Advise developers and architects on security best practices in cloud applications.
* Lead the introduction of new security capabilities into the organization including technology selection, design, and pilot.
* Lead the design, development, and implementation of the security infrastructure required to support the integration of security projects and technology into the existing environment.
* Ensure cloud environments adhere to relevant industry regulations, standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA), and internal security policies. Conduct periodic audits and assessments to validate compliance and identify areas for improvement.
* Evaluate the security capabilities of different cloud service providers and recommend the most suitable options based on the organization's requirements and risk appetite.
* Collaborate with the training department to develop cloud security training programs for employees. Raise awareness about cloud security best practices and common threats across the organization.
* Integrate security automation tools and processes to streamline security operations and improve response times to security incidents.
* Manage and resolves issues and escalates them appropriately.
* Follow all company and departmental policies, procedures, and standards


Key Requirements/Minimum Requirements:* Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent years of directly related experience (or high school +15 yrs; Assoc.+11 yrs; M.S.+4 yrs; PhD+3 yrs)
* The ability to fluently read, write, understand and communicate in English
* 7 Years of Meaningful Experience
* 5 Years of Demonstrated Leadership


Travel Requirements: 5%
Relocation Assistance: No
Sponsorship Available: No
ATTENTION: Current Alcon Employee/Contingent Worker
If you are currently an active employee/contingent worker at Alcon, please click the appropriate link below to apply on the Internal Career site.
Find Jobs for Employees
Find Jobs for Contingent Worker  

Alcon is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in E-Verify. Alcon takes pride in maintaining a diverse environment and our policies are not to discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. Alcon is also committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please send an email to alcon.recruitment@alcon.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

title: Business Analyst
description:
Overview:

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented **Business Analyst** to join our Customer Experience team. As part of this team, you will have the opportunity to work on the creation of transformational customer experiences including new digital portal, generative AI technology and dynamic routing capabilities. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between business needs and technological solutions. As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with stakeholders to gather, analyze, and document business requirements, facilitate communication, and ensure that project goals are met successfully. **\\*We’re opening this role to candidates located in commuting distance from our Durham, NC office as this will be a hybrid role.\\***
Responsibilities:
* **Requirements Gathering:**
* Collaborate with business stakeholders to elicit, analyze, and document detailed business requirements.
* Conduct interviews, workshops, and surveys to gather information from various sources.
* **Analysis and Documentation:**
* Analyze and document current state processes, systems, and workflows.
* Develop clear and concise business requirements, user stories, process flows, and other documentation as needed.
* Ensure that requirements are aligned with business goals and objectives.
* **Data Analysis:**
* Perform data analysis to support business needs, including data mapping, validation, and cleansing.
* Collaborate with data architects and database developers to design effective data solutions.
* **Communication:**
* Facilitate communication between business stakeholders and the project team.
* Present findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* **Quality Assurance:**
* Work closely with QA teams to ensure that testing efforts align with business requirements.
* Lead & participate in user acceptance testing (UAT) and provide support during the testing phase.
* **Continuous Improvement:**
* Identify opportunities for process improvement and propose effective solutions.
* Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies.
* **Project Management:**
* Assist in project planning, monitoring, and tracking to ensure timely and successful project delivery.
* Collaborate with project managers, developers, and other team members to achieve project objectives.

Qualifications:
* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar role.
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
* Proficient in the use of business analysis tools and methodologies.
* Familiarity with project management concepts and practices.
* Experience in data analysis and modeling is a plus.
* Experience working with global teams is a plus.


About Avalara:
**About Avalara:**  

We’re building cloud-based tax compliance solutions to handle every transaction in the world. Imagine every transaction you make — every tank of gas, cup of coffee, or pair of sneakers, every movie ticket, meal kit, or streamed song, every sensor-to-sensor ping. Nearly every time you make a purchase, physical or digital, there’s an accompanying unique and nuanced tax compliance calculation. The logic behind calculating taxes — the rules, rates, and boundaries is a global, layered, three-dimensional mess of complexity, with compliance dictated by governments and applied by every business, every day.  

Avalara works with businesses of all sizes, all over the world — from corner stores to gigantic global retailers — to calculate tax accurately and automatically, at speeds measured in milliseconds. That’s a massive technical challenge, in terms of scale, reliability, and complexity, and we do it better than anyone. That’s why we’re growing fast. Headquartered in Seattle, Avalara has offices across the U.S. and around the world, in Brazil, Canada, India, U.K, Belgium and across Europe. **Equal Opportunities:**
  

Avalara is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, creed, religion, age, gender, national orientation, disability, sexual orientation, US Veteran status, or any other factor protected by law.

title: Consultant, Technical Solutions - Remote Opportunity
description:
**Company Description**  

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.


Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

 **Job Description**  

The Technical Solutions team is tasked with supporting clients using Visa Digital products and services including, but not limited to, Visa Token Service and Visa Installments. As Consultant, Client Services you will be responsible for providing post-launch support to Visa Digital Solutions merchants, developers, and partners across the Global Enterprise, Mid-Market, and Small Business channels.


This role creates an exciting opportunity to be pivotal in achieving success for our clients who have live installments or tokenization solutions. This technical/functional specialist will interact with traditional and non-traditional financial institutions, processors, internal Client Success Managers, and external clients as well as be able to thrive in a highly collaborative environment.


This role also requires a solution-oriented thinker who can recommend feasible optimization opportunities to strengthen the overall product and client experience. You will be expected to handle escalated support requests, working with other teams inside and outside the Client Services organization.


As Consultant, you will also be responsible for acting as a subject matter expert, working with other Consultants and Senior Leaders, training and mentoring new team members in the organization.

**Main Job Tasks and Responsibilities**

* Act as the single point of technical contact for assigned merchant and partner accounts.
* Manage and troubleshoot escalated technical problems, interfacing with Product Development, Product Management, or Operations teams.
* Act in the role of subject matter expert on all aspects of the push payment platform ranging from product behavior to deep technical expertise.
* Provide technical implementation assistance to developers.
* Perform business analytics and performance monitoring of live merchants and partners.
* Provide eCommerce and payment acceptance consultative guidance and best-practices to merchants and partners.
* Educate merchants on how ongoing enhancements of Visa services may benefit their business.
* Create, edit, and distribute client notifications and communications.
* Participate in requirements, design, and roll out of new products and services.
* Represent Client Support to other departments in the company including sales, operations, product management, and product development.
* Partner with Sales to build relationships with technical and business contacts across the account portfolio.
* Stay current with industry and client trends and develop/maintain a strong knowledge of Visa products and services.
* Proactively identify operational opportunities with an eye on scalability, document recommendations to increase client experience, service quality, and efficiency.


This is a remote position. A remote position does not require job duties be performed within proximity of a Visa office location. Remote positions may be required to be present at a Visa office with scheduled notice.

 **Qualifications** **Basic Qualifications**

* 5 or more years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor's Degree or at least 2 years of work experience with an Advanced degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 0 years of work experience with a PhD

**Preferred Qualifications**

* 6 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor's Degree or 4 or more years of relevant experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or up to 3 years of relevant experience with a PhD
* 7+ years in-depth technical experience such as customer support, software development, or web development
* Client facing experience. Demonstrated success in customer relationship management.
* Candidate must be a self-starter and have a disposition to work independently with a commitment to detail in an organized manner.
* Experience working with e-commerce platforms, transaction processing and payment service providers (gateways).
* Understanding of mobile payments and architecture, including, NFC, TSMs, OTA, secure elements, contactless payments, online/remote payments, QR Codes, cloud-based payments and chip cards (contact and contactless).
* Demonstrated strong leadership capabilities and interpersonal skills.
* Executive-level written and verbal communication, and customer interaction skills.
* Strong organization skills including resolution management and follow up.
* Strong problem-solving skills.
* Experience with web-based software development technologies: PHP, ASP, NET, JavaScript, HTML, XML, JSON, REST APIs
* Understanding of Web Security: SSL, HTTPS, Hash algorithms
* Strong SQL skills
* Familiarity with PCI DSS

  

**Additional Information** **Work Hours:** Varies upon the needs of the department.

**Travel Requirements:** This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.

**Mental/Physical Requirements:** This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.


Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.


Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.

**U.S. APPLICANTS ONLY: The estimated salary range for a new hire into this position is $98,400 to $154,000 USD, which may include potential sales incentive payments (if applicable). Salary may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. In addition, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity. Visa has a comprehensive benefits package for which this position may be eligible that includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401 (k), FSA/HSA, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, and Wellness Program.**

title: Systems Administrator - IFS
description:
**Responsibilities:**

* Install, configure, and maintain IFS applications to meet business requirements.
* Implement and manage system configurations, including customization and integration with other enterprise systems.
* Monitor the performance of IFS applications, identify bottlenecks, and implement solutions to optimize system performance.
* Conduct regular system health checks and proactively address potential issues.
* Provide technical support to end-users, addressing IFS-related queries and issues.
* Develop and deliver training programs for end-users and other IT staff to ensure proficient use of IFS applications.
* Implement and maintain security measures to protect IFS applications and data.
* Ensure compliance with industry regulations and internal security policies.
* Plan and execute upgrades and patches for IFS applications in coordination with stakeholders.
* Test and validate changes to ensure system stability after updates.
* Develop and maintain backup and recovery procedures for IFS applications and associated data.
* Perform regular backups and conduct recovery drills to ensure data integrity.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, business analysts, and other IT professionals.
* Communicate effectively with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide status updates.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field preferred
* **Experience with cloud versions of IFS is a MUST**
* Proven experience as a Systems Administrator on IFS applications.
* Hands-on experience with IFS version upgrades, patches, and system configurations.
* In-depth knowledge of IFS applications, modules, and associated technologies.
* Familiarity with database management systems (e.g., Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server) supporting IFS.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration and user support.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues.

title: Developer - SDET 3
description: As a Lead Developer in Test, you will: The Lead Developer in Test serves as a technical expert/SME who owns the quality of software products delivered within the software development life cycle. • Develop and execute software testing components, develop automation solutions and perform manual tests as needed throughout the SCLC. • Ownership of automation architecture (both functional and performance) and set up test frameworks/infrastructure. • Identify project risks and develop mitigation strategies. • Perform Independent Assurance on all SCLC phases in a project. • Actively participate in collaborative resolution of defects including root cause analysis of production incidents. • Continually look for ways to innovate and improve testing process to gain efficiencies. • Demonstrate business domain expertise in the project involved. • Ensure compliance with FINRA technology policies and standards. • Ensure adherence with technology policies and compliance with all security controls. • Possess domain expertise in the project involved. Serve as technical subject matter expert. • Create and execute complex test strategies across multiple systems as required to execute tests. • Architect, design and develop automation code, scripts, utilities, simulators, data generators, API/Interface testing solutions and other programmatic test tools to test complex systems. • Review and provide feedback on system architecture, code and design documents. • Perform Independent Assurance on all SDLC phases in a project. • Effectively communicate testing activities, findings and project risk in oral and written formats. • Champion the collaborative resolution of defects including root cause analysis of production incidents. • Provide technical leadership and mentoring to a team of Developers in Test. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field or foreign equivalent plus 7 years' experience in software development and/or test automation. (JAVA, Python language preferred) • Testing process, test types, test design and testing methodologies • Modern programming languages and common development technologies with software architecture and design skills. • Functional or Performance or Security or DevOps test tools • Architecting, designing and developing automation frameworks and test suites. • Cloud related technologies • Unix/Linux environment

title: Services PreSales Architect
description:
**Get to know Okta**

  

Okta is The World's Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth.  

  

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we're looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences.  

  

Join our team! We're building a world where Identity belongs to you.

**The Services PreSales Architect Opportunity**



Reporting to the Director, Services PreSales Architecture, this role will is a technical authority on both cloud and on-premises based IAM systems and is responsible for ensuring the successful design and implementation of Okta's industry leading cloud identity platform for our customers. You will focus on Okta's workforce and customer identity offerings. You will develop relationships with customers to help them achieve their business goals while promoting creative solutions. You will establish yourself as a trusted partner with your customers with a focus on their success. You will translate business needs and insights into an actionable strategy that the delivery team can use to assist customers in driving their initiatives to results and high business value. This is a key member of the Professional Services (PS) Go-to-Market (GTM) team.


**What you'll be doing**


* Lead the pre-sales discovery of business, functional and technical requirements required to establish an Identity platform powered by Okta for our customers.
* Work with customers and services sales team to document and mitigate technical risk identified during discovery.
* Support creation of services estimates to implement the proposed solution.
* Review services estimates to ensure project scope can be successfully delivered as outlined - technical risk is appropriately mitigated and timelines follow staffing guidelines.


**Minimum REQUIRED Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**


* 7+ years of overall IT / software development experience, solution design and technical architecture experience
* 3+ years of Okta implementation experience
* 5+ years of consulting experience
* 5+ years driving application architecture design
* 5+ years of experience with (IAM) architectures
* 5+ years implementing cloud computing solutions including AWS, Google Apps, Salesforce etc
* Experience with employee and customer identity use cases: HR driven identity, Active Directory, SSO, SaaS application integrations
* Experience with Identity Governance and Privileged Access Management use cases
* Demonstrated ability to work and interact with CxOs and high-level customer executives
* Led discovery workshops to derive customer requirements, specifications, business processes
* Developed functional specifications and system design specifications for customer engagements
* Strong knowledge of Security Architecture, Design and Operations, LDAP, Active Directory, SSO, SAML, OIDC, RBAC, OAuth, JSON, REST
* Experience integrating with a multitude of On-Prem and SaaS based products
* Exhibits confidence and a deep understanding of emerging industry practices when solving business problems
* Identifies critical issues with ease
* Effectively communicates technical information to non-technical audiences
* Manages customer expectations effectively
* Application design experience
* Clear and Dynamic Communication
* Ability to travel up to 50%


**Highly Desirable Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**


* Knowledge of software development security and cryptography
* Familiarity with IAM solution providers
* Experience with API Gateways, CASB, and Reverse Proxies (NGINX)
* Knowledge of cloud/virtualization technologies, such as VMware vSphere, EC2, Xen, KVM, OpenStack
* Various open-source software and development tools
* Proficiency in one or more of .Net, Ruby, Java, Python or Perl
* git and Subversion


**Certification**


* Okta Certified Technical Architect or a combination of Okta Certified Consultant and Okta Certified Developer is a plus
* CISSP certification is a plus
* TOGAF certification is a plus


#LI-Remote



#LI-BF1

**The annual base salary range for this position for candidates located in the San Francisco Bay area is between:**

$196,000—$294,000 USD
Below is the annual base salary range for candidates located in California, Colorado, New York and Washington. Your actual base salary will depend on factors such as your skills, qualifications, experience, and work location. In addition, Okta offers equity (where applicable), bonus, and benefits, including health, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), flexible spending account, and paid leave (including PTO and parental leave) in accordance with our applicable plans and policies. To learn more about our Total Rewards program please visit: https://rewards.okta.com/us.

 **The annual base salary range for this position for candidates located in California (excluding San Francisco Bay Area), Colorado, New York, and Washington is between:**


$175,000—$263,000 USD**What you can look forward to as an Okta employee!**


* Amazing Benefits
* Making Social Impact
* Fostering Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging at Okta


Okta cultivates a dynamic work environment, providing the best tools, technology and benefits to empower our employees to work productively in a setting that best and uniquely suits their needs. Each organization is unique in the degree of flexibility and mobility in which they work so that all employees are enabled to be their most creative and successful versions of themselves, regardless of where they live. Find your place at Okta today! https://www.okta.com/company/careers/.



Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, marital status, age, physical or mental disability, or status as a protected veteran. We also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and convictions records, consistent with applicable laws. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please use this Form to request an accommodation.



Okta is committed to complying with applicable data privacy and security laws and regulations. For more information, please see our Privacy Policy at https://www.okta.com/privacy-policy/.

title: AWS Cloud Architect (REMOTE)
description:
**Kadiak**
**Job ID 24200044**
**Kadiak, LLC,** a Koniag Government Services company**,** is seeking an AWS Cloud Architect with a Top-Secret Security Clearance to support **Kadiak** and our government customer. **This is a Remote opportunity.**
We offer competitive compensation and an extraordinary benefits package including health, dental and vision insurance, 401K with company matching, flexible spending accounts, paid holidays, three weeks paid time off, and more.
Assists other engineers and the Government in requirements engineering, solutions engineering, scheduling, reliability, resiliency, services development, integration, test and evaluation, maintainability, and analysis.
**Essential Functions, Responsibilities & Duties may include, but are not limited to:**
* Participate in technical project review meetings to ensure technical designs meet the client’s operational requirements and infrastructure/security standards.
* Provision and maintain cloud resources for an enterprise cloud environment (network, storage, compute)
* Automate infrastructure migrations to cloud environments and identify on-premises technologies and their cloud counterparts.
* Ensure compliance with incidents, problems, and change management procedures and execute ticket-based requests with little or no additional help.
* Focus on results and be delivery oriented, with a keen interest in quality and the ability to meet deadlines.

**Work Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:**
* Top Secret DoD Clearance Required Must have a valid Driver’s License.
* At least 4 years of progressive experience administering, designing, and engineering cloud solutions.
* Sound fundamental knowledge of cloud technology and enterprise IT systems.
* Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with experience exercising mature judgment.
* Experience deploying resources into and running workloads in Amazon Web Services and/or Microsoft Azure
* Ability to clearly translate technical requirements and concepts in a manner that appeals to a wide audience.
* Experience working independently with minimal supervision and guidance.
* Experience with operating systems and software: upgrade planning and implementation.
* Fundamental knowledge of and experience working in a DevOps centric environment
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines, automation tools, code promotion processes and methodologies.
* Experience with scripting languages such as python, json, YAML or others.
* Experience with deploying infrastructure as code using AWS CloudFormation templates, Azure ARM templates, Chef, Terraform or other automation tools.
* BS degree in Computer Science. Engineering, or related field, or equivalent experience

**Preferred, Not required:**
* Amazon Web Services Associate or Professional Level certifications
* Microsoft Azure Solutions Architect, Developer, DevOps Engineer or similar
* Working Knowledge of Systems Administration in Windows and Linux
* Foundational knowledge of AWS Services including but not limited to EC2, RDS, S3, EBS and IAM.
* Working familiarity with Scripting Languages such as Python, PowerShell, and Bash

**Working Environment & Conditions**
This job operates in a professional office environment and has a noise level of mostly low to moderate. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.
This position is primarily indoors, consistent with a standard office position and has a noise level of mostly low to moderate. The incumbent is required to stand, walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. The workload may require the incumbent to sit for extended periods of time. The incumbent must be able to read, do simple math calculations and withstand moderate amounts of stress.
The incumbent must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 lbs. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
**Our Equal Employment Opportunity Policy**
The company is an equal opportunity employer. The company shall not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, or gender identity (except where gender is a bona fide occupational qualification), national origin, age, disability, military/veteran status, marital status, genetic information, or any other factor protected by law. We are committed to equal employment opportunity in all decisions related to employment, promotion, wages, benefits and all other privileges, terms, and conditions of employment.
The company is dedicated to seeking all qualified applicants. If you require accommodation to navigate or to apply for a position on our website, please contact Heaven Wood via e-mail at accommodations@koniag-gs.com or by calling 703-488-9377 to request accommodation.
Koniag Government Services (KGS) is an Alaska Native Owned corporation supporting the values and traditions of our native communities through an agile employee and corporate culture that delivers Enterprise Solutions, Professional Services and Operational Management to Federal Government Agencies. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Koniag, we apply our proven commercial solutions to a deep knowledge of Defense and Civilian missions to provide forward leaning technical, professional, and operational solutions. KGS enables successful mission outcomes for our customers through solution-oriented business partnerships and a commitment to exceptional service delivery. We ensure long-term success with a continuous improvement approach while balancing the collective interests of our customers, employees, and native communities. For more information, please visit www.koniag-gs.com.
**Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled. Shareholder Preference in accordance with Public Law 88-352**

title: Ruby Developer
description:
We are seeking an experienced Ruby Developer to join our growing team. As a Ruby Developer, you will create systems, software and cloud environments and manage and maintain crucial systems. With this, you will contribute to the design, development, integration and testing of the program as a vital member of the software development team. You will play a significant part in the development of the cloud based systems.

This role resides in our Cyber Operations department and reports to our Project Manager.
SIXGEN supports cyber and intelligence missions by serving government and commercial organizations as they overcome global cybersecurity challenges. Our highly skilled operators conduct research and assessments based on real-world threats. We simulate adversaries and malicious actors to report details and findings on critical assets and infrastructures. Our program planners advise mission owners to bring rapid solutions to intelligence mission leaders. Using innovative process, tools, and techniques, we predict and overcome cybersecurity vulnerabilities. Our successes are supported by our diverse team of experienced, technical talent. SIXGEN is growing our support to our mission by adding an ambitious Ruby Developer to our team. SIXGEN, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Veterans/Disabled Employer.
**Core Responsibilities:**
* Produce clean and efficient code based on requirements
* Optimize queries for performance
* Writing tests, performing quality assurance, and reviewing code scans
* Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing software

* Experience in Software Development using languages such as, Ruby, Javascript, MySQL and elasticsearch

We are committed to fostering an inclusive culture that values diversity in our people, reflecting the communities we serve and our customer base. We strive to attract and retain a diverse talent pool and create an environment where everyone is empowered to be their authentic selves at work.
