title: Salesforce Functional Consultant
description:
**Demand Chain has built a company and culture that improves the lives of our team, clients, and the communities around us. We work hard to ensure our teammates feel engaged, motivated, challenged, with a sense of belonging, so they can thrive.****Defining traits of our culture include: passion, a sense of urgency, integrity, accountability, adaptability, ownership, joy, and optimism. We’re problem solvers, life-long learners, experts in our industry, slightly sarcastic, but always fun-loving.****Sound like you? Want to grow, develop, build meaningful relationships, and create value for the communities around us?****JOIN OUR TEAM!****Demand Chain Salesforce Functional Consultant**  

**Who will be successful in this role?*** People with a high technical aptitude
* Exceptional communication skills
* Problem solvers
* Relationship builders
* Natural curiosity
* Continuous learner

Utilizing Salesforce BA skills, you will be part of a team responsible for delivering enterprise cloud technology solutions to our customers.
- Work with clients to gather, understand, and define business requirements.

- Bachelor’s Degree strongly preferred.

title: Director of Innovation and Technology (remote)
description:
.


We’re looking for a Director of Innovation and Technology to lead, develop, and implement the organization's overall technology strategy. This person will ensure that HSRI’s technology initiatives align with our principles, goals, and mission. They will identify emerging technologies and trends and make recommendations when appropriate to the executive and leadership teams. This role involves managing a multidisciplinary team, driving innovation, optimizing technology resources, understanding technology needs, and playing a pivotal role in data governance to support projects and programs.

 **Who We Are**


HSRI is a nonprofit organization that conducts research and evaluation to improve health and human service systems. We work at the local, state, and federal levels. We help develop measures, data collection instruments and protocols, advanced analytics, and data visualization strategies. Our goal is to help public agencies understand and demonstrate the real-world impact of the services they provide, helping them transform their policies and practices to improve their outcomes.

  

Our teams have an unwavering commitment to envisioning equitable policies and solutions that create a stronger society for us all. HSRI is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to building a diverse team, bringing as many possible perspectives as possible to bear on services that can profoundly affect people’s health and well-being by addressing social determinants of health. We are committed to building an inclusive environment where people of all backgrounds can come to do their best work.

 **Responsibilities**

* Evaluate and implement innovative solutions for the organization and in collaboration with project staff that enhance research capabilities and productivity
* Manage research and development activities to stay ahead of industry trends, explore new technologies, and maintain a competitive edge
* Prepare regular reports and presentations on the department's performance, projects, and technology trends
* Monitor the performance of technology systems and identify opportunities for optimization and efficiency improvements
* Oversee the development of new products and/or enhancements to existing products, ensuring they align with the organization’s technology vision
* Set standards by ensuring that technology solutions are scalable, secure, and meet performance requirements
* Collaborate with other team leads, researchers, project directors, and management to understand their technology needs and provide solutions
* Manage product and team performance by setting goals, establishing priorities, and conducting regular performance evaluations
* Manage departmental budgets and resources efficiently, ensuring cost-effectiveness
* Identify organizational technology needs and support the process of hiring or identifying appropriate vendors. Evaluate and negotiate contracts with technology vendors and service providers.
* Work in collaboration with others to develop and implement a comprehensive data governance framework to ensure data quality, privacy, and security across the organization
* Establish and maintain data management policies and procedures, including data classification, access controls, and data lifecycle management

 **Other Duties and Responsibilities**

* Provide oversight for technology-related projects, ensuring they are executed effectively, on time, and within budget
* Collaborate with project managers, data stewards, and researchers to identify and mitigate risks
* Act as a liaison between the technology department and other staff
* Establish and maintain data management policies and procedures, including data classification, access controls, and data lifecycle management
* Additional duties, as assigned

 **Supervisory Responsibility**

* Lead, mentor, and motivate a diverse team of technology professionals, including engineers, developers, database administrators, and support staff
* Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture that encourages knowledge-sharing and cross-functional cooperation
* Work closely with teams to understand their technology needs. Communicate effectively with executives and other clients and funders.

 **Minimum Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in a relevant field; advanced degree preferred. 8-10 years of experience in technology leadership roles, preferably in a non-profit, research, or innovation-focused environment
* Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure and AWS
* Familiarity with database management systems
* Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities
* Ability to manage and lead multidisciplinary teams
* Ability to align technology initiatives with overall business objectives
* Ability to define and support data stewardship
* Financial acumen for budget management
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and collaborative work environment
* Ensure ongoing training and development for technology staff. Keep the team's skills up to date with industry advancements.

 **Hours**


Full-time – 40 hours


This position allows flexibility in core hours.

 **Location**


This is a remote position with an option to work from our Cambridge, MA, office, which is accessible by public transportation. HSRI does not permit remote work arrangements based in California, the U.S. Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, and outside the United States.

  

Must have unrestricted authorization to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment visa at this time.

 **Additional Information**


HSRI offers a comprehensive benefits package which includes:

* Health
* Dental
* Short- and Long-Term Disability
* Life Insurance
* 403(b) Retirement Plan
* Flexible Spending Accounts
* Education Assistance Program
* 10 Paid Holidays
* Remote Work Stipends (e.g., home office improvements, mobile/internet services)

 **Salary Range**


$154,288 - $196,037


Pay is commensurate with skills and experience.

  

HSRI is committed to pay equity in providing employees with equal pay for equal work and carefully considers a wide range of compensation factors, including, but not limited to, prior experience, education, certification(s), license(s), skills, expertise, location, internal equity, and other factors that are job-related and consistent with the organization’s needs. Depending on eligibility, your offer may include 403(b) participation, paid time off, and medical, dental, group disability, and life insurance coverage. Our offer of employment takes into consideration total compensation, including benefits.

  

For more information on HSRI, please visit www.hsri.org.

 **How to Apply**


Interested candidates are encouraged to submit a cover letter and resume/CV through HSRI’s Career Center.


You can copy/paste the URL into your browser: https://workforcenow.adp.com/jobs/apply/posting.html?client=hsri&ccId=19000101\\_000001&type=MP&lang=en\\_US ;

  

You can also mail materials to:


Attention: Human Resources


Human Services Research Institute


2336 Massachusetts Ave.


Cambridge, MA 02140

  

No phone calls or email inquiries, please.

 **Disclaimer**


This profile is intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to do this job. The above is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and duties required and should not be construed as declaring what the specific duties and responsibilities of any position shall be. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with/or without notice.

  

External and internal applicants, as well as position incumbents who become disabled as defined under the American Disabilities Act (ADA), must be able to perform the essential job functions (as listed) either unaided or with the assistance of a reasonable accommodation to be determined by leadership on a case-by-case basis.

title: ETL/SSIS Developer
description:
Responsibilities:

* Design, develop, and maintain ETL processes to support data integration and transformation requirements.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
* Implement data mappings, transformations, and data quality rules to ensure accurate and reliable data processing.
* Perform data profiling and analysis to identify data quality issues and improvement opportunities.
* Develop and execute efficient and optimized SQL queries for data extraction and transformation.
* Optimize and enhance existing ETL workflows to improve performance, scalability, and data quality.
* Collaborate with database administrators and data engineers to ensure seamless integration with data sources and targets.
* Document ETL processes, data mappings, and configurations for future reference and troubleshooting.
* Conduct thorough testing and debugging of ETL processes to ensure accurate and reliable data processing.
* Stay updated with emerging ETL technologies, industry best practices, and data integration trends.
* Strong SQL programming skills and strong RDBMS knowledge.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful integration of ETL solutions with other systems and applications.
* Utilize testing tools and techniques to ensure the quality and reliability of ETL processes.
* Support troubleshooting efforts and provide timely resolution for production issues related to ETL processes.

Required Skills:

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
* At least 10 years of experience within the Information Technologies ETL tools like Informatica PowerCenter or SSIS
* Proven experience as an ETL Developer or similar role, with a strong understanding of ETL concepts and methodologies.
* Good experience with Informatica cloud migration projects.
* Proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases.
* Strong data analysis and data manipulation skills.
* Experience with ETL tools such as Informatica, SSIS, or Talend.
* Familiarity with data modeling, data warehousing, and data integration concepts.
* Knowledge of scripting languages such as Python or UNIX Shell scripting.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Ability to prioritize tasks, manage deadlines, and deliver high-quality results.
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies and development practices is a plus

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
**Full Stack Developer (Magento Focus)**

We are looking for a full stack developer who has experience with Magento 2. As a full stack developer, your primary focus will be developing, maintaining, and enhancing our Magento 2 based store. You may also be tasked with assisting in development of our custom multi-tenant application built with Laravel and VueJS. You will work closely with our design, marketing, and business teams to deliver high-quality and user-friendly solutions that meet our business goals and customer needs.

**Who we are looking for:**

* A developer interested in joining a small team working to create software for a large and stable company.
* Someone interested in creating software that impacts and improves people’s lives for the better. (We’re not just saying that - we are building innovative software to help people battling drug addictions and viral/bacterial sicknesses. We are making a real difference in people’s lives.)
* A person who values code integrity and strives to develop secure software.
* A developer interested in writing their own code for new, cutting-edge software, not maintaining legacy systems.
* Preferably someone who is a bit of a geek.

**To be successful in this role, you should have the following skills and qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, or related field, or equivalent work experience
* Proficient in PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax, VueJS, MySQL, Redis.
* Familiar with creating and integrating with APIs.
* Familiar with Magento 2 architecture, coding standards, and best practices.
* Experience with Docker, Composer, Vite, Git, and other development tools.
* Understanding of design principles behind scalable applications.
* Understanding of Cloud Providers such as AWS, Google, or Azure.
* Knowledge of web development frameworks such as Laravel, Symfony, or Zend
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Excellent communication, problem-solving, and debugging skills.

**Nice to haves:**

* Experience with Magento 2 architecture, coding standards, and best practices.
* Experience with JSON:API Specification
* Experience with Fishbowl Inventory System
* Located in Southwest Pennsylvania

**What we offer:**

* Work From Home
* Competitive Pay
* 8 Holidays off, 40hr vacation, 40hr sick leave.
* Health, Vision, and Dental Benefits
* A long-term career with a growing company.

title: Tableau Developer
description:
**Job Title:** Tableau Developer


**Location:** Remote


**Duration:** Full-time


**Job Description:**

We are seeking a talented Tableau Developer to join our team. This role offers the opportunity to work remotely and contribute to the development of data analytics solutions using Tableau, Snowflake, and other related technologies. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of data fundamentals, with expertise in Tableau reporting and Snowflake data warehouse, along with excellent communication and collaboration skills.


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and maintain Tableau reports and dashboards to support business analytics and decision-making processes.
* Utilize Snowflake data warehouse and other data sources to extract, transform, and load data for reporting and visualization purposes.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, understand business needs, and translate them into technical solutions.
* Design and implement data visualization solutions using Tableau, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and relevance of information.
* Work closely with data engineers and analysts to ensure data quality, integrity, and consistency across reporting solutions.
* Participate in the development and implementation of data governance policies and procedures to ensure data security and compliance.
* Provide support and troubleshooting for Tableau-related issues, and implement solutions to optimize performance and usability.
* Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in data analytics, data visualization, and related technologies.

**Required Skills:**

* Data analytics mindset, with a strong understanding of data fundamentals and methodologies.
* Experience with Tableau reporting and data visualization tools.
* Proficiency in Snowflake data warehouse, including data modeling, ETL processes, and data manipulation.
* Strong understanding of data concepts, technologies, and methodologies, including data engineering, analytics, and data governance.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and relationship-building skills.
* Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions and vice versa.
* Hustle attitude, startup-minded, and collaborative spirit.
* Experience with Matillion is a huge plus.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Certification or training in Tableau and Snowflake.
* Experience with other data visualization tools and technologies.
* Knowledge of cloud ETL tools such as Matillion.
* Familiarity with agile methodologies and practices.
* Previous experience in a remote work environment.

title: Jr. Fullstack Developer (Java and JavaScript)
description:
**Jr. Fullstack Developer (Java & JavaScript) - FULLY REMOTE (VA based is preferred)**

**Overview:**

We are seeking a Jr. Fullstack Developer proficient in both Java and JavaScript to be a part of our growing team. The successful candidate should have a solid foundation in both frontend and backend development, possess experience in Agile methodologies, and be eager to continue learning and adapting to new technologies.

**Mandatory Skills:**

1. Java:

* Solid understanding of object-oriented programming (OOP) principles.
* Experience with popular Java frameworks like Spring Boot, Hibernate.
* Familiarity with Java-based tools such as Maven or Gradle.
* Knowledge of Java-related optimization and debugging techniques.

2. JavaScript:

* Hands-on experience with at least one JavaScript framework/library (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js).
* Understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX.

3. Databases:

* Good knowledge of SQL and experience working with relational databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Oracle.
* Basic understanding of NoSQL databases such as MongoDB or Cassandra.

4. Version Control:

* Proficiency with git, understanding of branching, merging, and commit strategies.

5. Agile Methodologies:

* Proven experience working in Agile teams.
* Familiarity with Agile tools and practices (e.g., Scrum, Kanban, user stories, stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives).
* Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively in a fast-paced, iterative environment. Optional (But Appreciated)

**Skills:**

1. Containerization: Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, or similar technologies.

2. Cloud Platforms: Familiarity with **AWS**, Azure, or Google Cloud services related to application deployment and scaling.

3. Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD): Knowledge of Jenkins, Travis CI, CircleCI, or similar tools.

4. Testing: Experience with unit testing tools/frameworks like JUnit for Java and Jest or Mocha for JavaScript. Familiarity with end-to-end testing frameworks like Selenium or Cypress.

5. Web Security: Understanding of secure coding practices and familiarity with tools and techniques to identify security vulnerabilities.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (or equivalent experience).
* 1 year of professional experience as a Fullstack Developer or in a similar role.
* Resided in the USA for the previous 2 years.

**Personal Attributes:**

* Strong problem-solving skills and a keen attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
* A passion for continuous learning and staying updated with the latest industry trends.

Candidates who exhibit a combination of depth in server-side logic, a passion for perfecting the user experience, and strong Agile experience will be at the top of our list. If you're enthusiastic about the full software development life cycle, from concept to deployment, within an Agile framework, we'd like to meet you!

To apply, please submit your resume and a tailored cover letter to hr@geodesicgov.com. Please attach your resume and cover letter as PDF files. We look forward to reviewing your application.

title: Backend PHP Developer
description:
**About us**

HappyCow, a global platform assisting people in making conscious, kind, and healthy food choices, is seeking a Backend PHP Developer to join our dynamic and collaborative team. Our platform lists hundreds of thousands of vegan-friendly restaurants and stores worldwide.

We are seeking a PHP Developer who is passionate about developing scalable web applications and eager to bring innovative solutions to our global platform.

**Your Responsibilities:**

* Develop and maintain the backend of our web applications.
* Work closely with our frontend team to design and implement APIs.
* Participate in the deployment and management of server hosting in cloud environments.
* Stay up-to-date with new technology trends and coding standards.
* Contribute ideas for new features and improvements to our platform's architecture and infrastructure.

**Requirements:**

* 3+ years of experience in backend development with a solid foundation in PHP
* Proficient with Linux, PHP, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, MVC, MySQL/MariaDB
* Comfortable with git
* Experience with the Phalcon web framework (or other PHP/web frameworks)
* Experience with AWS services such as EC2, S3, Lambda, API Gateway, Cloudfront
* Experience with Stripe integration
* Experience with HA web services and DB replication
* Experience with ManticoreSearch, RabbitMQ, PHPUnit, RESTful API design and development
* Fluent in English with excellent communication skills

**Nice to Haves:**

* Experience with additional databases (e.g., PostgreSQL) and Google Services.

**Why Join Us?**

* Make a tangible positive impact on a global scale with our leading platform.

* Engage in continuous learning and professional development opportunities.
* Competitive salary

Interested in the role? Send us a message explaining why you're interested in working for HappyCow, along with a portfolio of projects you've worked on (if available), to jobs@happycow.net.

title: Presales Engineer/Solutions Architect
description:
**Who we are**


Incredibuild empowers developers to radically accelerate their work by shortening build times, allowing more iterations and faster product releases. Thousands of customers including world-leading brands trust our platform to streamline and accelerate everything from compilation to release automation, generating great savings of resources and accelerating Time-To-Market for leading brands.


We’ve helped over 200,000 developers at tech giants like Microsoft, Samsung, Nintendo, Amazon, and many others to develop some of the most successful software in many industries such as gaming, financial services, Embedded software, and more.


In the past three years, Incredibuild has been in hyper-growth, expanding globally with no signs of slowing. We have secured multiple rounds of investments to keep expanding our market share.


This is your opportunity to join a category leader and make a difference.


To read more

  

We are seeking a dynamic and self-driven Solution Architect to join our Solution Architecture team. In this role, you will be instrumental in understanding our customers' needs, formulating effective solutions, and ensuring they derive maximum value from our cutting-edge solutions. This is an exciting opportunity to thrive in a challenging, fast-paced environment.

 **﻿What you'll be doing:**

* Lead technical and business discussions, articulating the unique value of Incredibuild.
* Serve as the technical owner throughout the sales cycle, ensuring a seamless experience for our customers.
* Conduct demo calls with prospects and potential partners, showcasing the power and capabilities of Incredibuild solutions.
* Manage end-to-end Proof of Concepts (POCs), including defining KPIs, implementation, execution, support, and delivering impactful results.
* Focus on providing value by deeply understanding customer pains and needs, and presenting tailored business solutions.
* Present Incredibuild solutions to diverse stakeholders, ranging from C-level executives to developers.
* Collaborate with Account Executives and prospects to technically qualify opportunities.

  

Requirements:  

  

**What You'll Need:**

* 3-5 years of experience as a Solution Architect, SE, or Solution Consultant.
* Excellent written, presentation, and verbal communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to present technology recommendations from a business perspective.
* Independent and self-driven, with a proven ability to work remotely.
* Proficient infrastructure wizard with expertise in Windows, Linux, network, and IT security in both on-premises and cloud environments.
* Knowledge of SDLC & CI/CD infrastructure, build systems, and ecosystem tools.
* Strong hands-on background with the ability to troubleshoot complex systems.
* Ability to work under pressure, managing multiple opportunities and POCs concurrently.
* Demonstrated ability to work independently and remotely.
* Development experience, especially in C/C++ - **advantage.**

  

Compensation Range: $155,000-$200,000 base salary (+ benefits, including generous 401K, unlimited PTO, generous medical coverage, life insurance, commute expenses, food allowance). In addition to the base salary, this role includes the opportunity to earn performance-based compensation and/or a discretionary bonus, in accordance with the Company's policies. Compensation finally awarded will be commensurate with the candidate’s skills and experience.

title: Magento Tech Lead
description:
ABOUT ENCORA



Encora is a leading-edge technology services company with competencies in cloud development and eCommerce. Our focus on engineering and customer-centric agile development methodologies ensure that our clients are successful in enabling their businesses with winning solutions. If you're really bright, passionate about world-changing software, and want to do something amazing, join us!

  



JOB DESCRIPTION



Encora is looking for a Magento Technical Lead. We are looking for super-stars to work with cutting edge technologies and develop awesome user experiences. The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of IT experience and 3+ years of development experience in Magento 2.0. The Magento developer will be working on a variety of projects, working with Magento 2, OO PHP development, MVC Frameworks, CI and more! As a Magento Developer, you'll work with a small team, while remaining very much hands-on.

  



QUALIFICATIONS


* 5+ years of experience in IT


* 3+ years of development experience in Magento 2.0


* Custom Module Development in Magento 2.x


* Automated Product Import Export in Magento 2.x


* Strong experience in web technologies like PHP, MySQL, JavaScript, HTML/CSS


* Understanding of MVC design pattern and framework.


* Worked in multiple E-commerce projects in Magento 2.x


* Experience in the development of custom modules, System Architecture, Payment Gateway in Magento 2.x


* Can write custom extensions


* Strong knowledge of eCommerce platform


* Knowledge of Linux and MySQL


* Magento specific optimization skills with the ability to analyze performance


* Experience in Magento 2 Major & Minor version upgrades

  



RESPONSIBILITES


* Work with product owners to determine and document application requirement


* Suggest technical solutions to business problems/opportunities


* Implement discovered requirements, whether through existing application interface or via custom enhancements


* Coordinate and execute data migration/integration initiatives


* Collaborate with offshore developers within a team environment


* Manage timelines and expectations by effectively prioritizing tasks and keeping open lines of communication with business stakeholders


* Conduct code review sessions


* Prepare code for production deployment


* Follow Encora coding best practices


* Document design and implementation details of new systems and features


* Keep abreast of new development tools and techniques

title: Intel SW EMEA/ APJ Sales Leader
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

  

We are going beyond silicon. While Intel is known for its silicon portfolio, with 19,000 developers, we are one of the largest software companies in the world. We are on an audacious mission to transform Intel's commercial software portfolio into a major growth pillar for the company. Intel's software portfolio spans AI as a Service, Intel's Developer Cloud, Trust and Security solutions, and Infrastructure optimization solutions. As a result, our customers are harnessing real business value and achieving otherwise unobtainable outcomes. The Intel Global Sales, Marketing and Communications Team exists to deliver a world-class experience to our global, diverse, ever-expanding customers in a way that maximizes revenue, design wins and our reputation, so that we can exceed growth expectations. Responsibilities Include: The Intel Software EMEA/ APJ Sales Leader will be responsible for driving the business from a strategic and financial perspective. This leader will be responsible for setting the regional KPIs and delivering to revenue targets for the Software SaaS business in alignment with overall corporate objectives. The leader will be responsible for timely execution of the overall strategy. The leader will also play a key role in providing inputs into product strategy and the roadmap working closely with the SATG BU. This leader is expected to set KPI's and own revenue and accountability towards the BU growth objectives. This leader will be foundational in building and growing healthy teams through talent management, diversity and inclusion, coaching, and career development. With their teams, the leader will be responsible to inspire and foster a culture of customer centricity, direct solution sales, adoption and use through collaboration with peers and extended teams.  

**Qualifications**
------------------

  

15+ years in diverse leadership roles, driving and implementing revenue growth. Proven track record of growing SW/SaaS revenue to tens of millions of dollars in ARR at scale. Ability to craft and execute a sales strategy effectively. Experience with sales and organizational transformation. Strong strategic planning and execution skills. Analytical mindset with a focus on data-driven decision-making. Inspirational leadership style and hands-on approach. Make data-driven decisions to improve performance. experience of general management/commercial leadership experience in complex technology solutions. Experience and deep understanding of Solutions eco-system, offerings, and business models; SaaS, PaaS, etc. Exemplify agile leadership in a high paced environment experience. Experienced international leader of people, able to inspire and build followship. History of developing others, recruiting top talent, and getting them to collaborate as a high-functioning team. Role model exceptional interpersonal skills, display cultural sensitivity and work as a team player. Model Intel values, culture, and leadership practices to grow pipeline of managers and leaders. Experience in leading go-to-market strategy with a diversified portfolio. Extraordinary teamwork and collaboration with a strong customer-first mindset. Strategic thinker with a proven track record of industry thought leadership and demonstrated business results. Strong communication and influencing skills including experience presenting to executives, customers and technical audiences.  

**Inside this Business Group**
------------------------------

  

Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customer voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions.  

**Posting Statement**
---------------------

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.  

**Benefits**
------------

  

We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.  

**Working Model**
-----------------

  

This role is available as a fully home-based and generally would require you to attend Intel sites only occasionally based on business need. This role may also be available as our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. **In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.**  

  

**Position of Trust**  

This role is a Position of Trust. Should you accept this position, you must consent to and pass an extended Background Investigation, which includes (subject to country law), extended education, SEC sanctions, and additional criminal and civil checks. For internals, this investigation may or may not be completed prior to starting the position. For additional questions, please contact your Recruiter.

title: Dynamics 365 F&O Support Developer
description:
**Levridge Inc. is a leading ag-tech firm specializing in providing transformative business technology solutions for the agricultural enterprise built on the cloud-based Microsoft platform. Leveraging cutting-edge technology and industry expertise, Levridge empowers agribusinesses to streamline operations, drive efficiency, and optimize performance.****With a portfolio of innovative solutions, including a pioneering SaaS platform for managing equity at cooperatives, Levridge is committed to revolutionizing the agricultural industry. We play as hard as we work, we embrace every opportunity to learn and share our success. What are you waiting for? Join us!**  

Levridge, is looking for a highly motivated, honest, and passionate person who wants to join our team as a Developer in Support. We're creating industry-shaping IP to help agriculture businesses take advantage of the robust infrastructure that Microsoft Dynamics provides.
### **A Day in the Life**

+ Write clean, scalable code using X++ programming languages.
+ Modifying or creating forms, SSRS reports, tables, or custom logic in X++ according to requirements within the time allotted by the estimates provided.
+ Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues through testing and bug fixes within Dynamics 365 environments.
+ Working with functional consultants and product managers to understand features and relay accurately and effectively what changes have been made.
+ Relaying status updates as needed to project managers and other team members.
+ Unit and regression testing of customizations and product features.
+ When needed, build modifications for clients according to the designs.
+ Write blogs on topics to contribute to the Levridge blog.
+ Explain technical features to functional team members.
+ Represent Levridge by communicating with clients regarding D365 F&SCM technical support cases via telephone, electric correspondence, and in person.
+ Triage client issues and scope time and resources required to provide solutions.
+ Solve client technical support issues through utilization of product knowledge, business acumen and technical expertise.
+ Log and properly track support cases in Microsoft Dynamics CRM.
+ Collaborate with resources from other teams/groups as needed to resolve client issues.
  


### **Preferred Qualifications**

+ Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Business, Computer Science or related field, or at least 5 years of Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&SCM (and/or previous versions) development experience.
+ 2+ year of programming in X++ and proven experience of building, deployment, and migration of F&O solutions in development, test, pre-production, and production environments.
+ 4+ years of experience with .NET, SQL, JavaScript, and C#, visual studio.
+ Ability to write maintainable and testable code.
+ Experience with SQL Server / SSIS / SSRS.
+ Experience and knowledge of Azure DevOps.
+ Proven experience with unit testing.
+ Ability to communicate effectively in both spoken and written English.
+ Comfortable and confident in establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with Levridge teams and Clients.
+ Ability to work in a team environment and independently.
+ Relevant Microsoft Certifications and/or working on obtaining relevant MS development certifications.
  


### **Health and Wellness**

+ Medical Insurance (premiums for employees paid for by the company)
+ Dental Insurance
+ Vision insurance
+ 401(k) contribution program (US) or RRSP Benefits (Canada)
+ Life insurance
+ Disability Benefits
+ Paid parental leave
+ Paid flexible time off
+ Paid sick time (US) or floater days (Canada)
+ Paid holidays
+ Flexible work schedules
+ Mobile/internet reimbursement
+ Employee and family assistance program
+ Learning and development allowance
+ Employer charitable contribution
+ Social wellness clubs
+ Professional coaching
+ Paid business mileage
+ Home office and wellness allowance (US Only)
+ HSA contribution (US Only)
  


### **Compensation**


Our philosophy is to provide compensation that is Competitive, Equitable, and Driven by Performance. Various factors impact our pay ranges including market conditions and national salary data. To determine competitive salaries within this range we consider candidates skills, qualifications, and experience. These are national ranges, inclusive of bonus opportunities and could represent multiple role levels.  

+ 
  

US (USD): $75,000 - $110,000  

We live and breathe our core values:
Integrity | Technical Excellence | Tenacity | Client Centric | Enjoy Our Work

They are the fabric of our company and a reflection of our organizational culture. Our values are a part of our talent acquisition process, how we operate our company and how we partner with our clients. We enjoy our work by exhibiting our technical excellence and tenacity while being inherently client-centric with integrity toward every customer engagement.
We will comply with local guidelines regarding infectious diseases and vaccine requirements.

Team members who are required to travel to client sites, conferences and events that are not in Levridge/Stoneridge Software offices, must comply with the client's COVID-19 policies and procedures or have an approved exemption.

We are committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us unique. Growing the best team is at the center of our strategic plan. To be successful in this, we strive to create an inclusive environment and build a sense of belonging by celebrating our differences and ensuring fair and equitable treatment for all our team members.

title: Portal Developer
description:
Since 1869 we've connected people through food they love. Our history was created by remarkable people, ideas, and innovations. It serves as inspiration and foundation for our future success. We’re proud to be stewards of amazing brands that people trust. We foster a culture of belonging where people come first, and diversity is embraced. And we live our values, always, while setting the highest standards for performance.
Here, you will make a difference every day. You will be part of a dynamic, collaborative, and competitive team. You will be supported to build a rewarding career with opportunities to grow, innovate and inspire. Make history with us.
What role will you play? How will you make history with Campbell’s? Apply today!
The Portal Developer implements, manages and continuously improves digital workplace technology and integrations with adjacent technologies (e.g. ServiceNow, SharePoint, Teams, Power Platform, Conversational AI products).
This position is also responsible for designing, developing, and implementing solutions using the Microsoft Power Platform. This includes creating custom applications, automating business processes, integrating data from various sources and ensuring the maintenance of our ecosystems uses collaboration methods that are cutting-edge and are delivered securely, with reliability and resiliency in a method that is as intuitive to the customer as possible.
This position will also collaborate with technology vendors, product managers, IT security and legal or compliance teams to ensure alignment to company policy and applicable legislation. This role will work with business stakeholders and requires strong analysis skills.
This role will also be responsible understanding all aspects of Microsoft 365 Teams, Sharepoint & Power Platform including administration, design, support, and training.  

Main Responsibilities* Designing and developing custom SharePoint portals and applications using SharePoint Framework, SharePoint Designer, and other tools
* Collaborating with business stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into technical requirements.
* Integrating data from various sources, including SQL Server, Excel, and other enterprise systems
* Creating and maintaining custom web parts, workflows, and forms to automate business processes.
* Providing technical support and troubleshooting for SharePoint portals and applications
* Staying up-to-date with the latest developments in SharePoint and related technologies
* Mentoring and coaching junior developers
* Designing and developing custom applications using PowerApps, Power Automate, and other components of the Microsoft Power Platform
* Collaborating with business stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into technical requirements.
* Integrating data from various sources, including SharePoint, SQL Server, and other enterprise systems
* Automating business processes using Power Automate and other workflow tools
* Creating and maintaining technical documentation, including design specifications, user guides, and release notes
* Staying up-to-date with the latest developments in the Power Platform and related technologies
* Mentoring and coaching junior developers
* Development of KPI dashboards which provide insights into environment.
* Validating application functionality
* Perform workloads using Agile methodology.
* Implement, monitor and operate digital workplace technologies (endpoint hardware, software, services and SaaS tools).
* Integrate digital workplace technologies with adjacent technologies (identity, security, vulnerability management, IT service and asset management, remote access, backup, directory services, etc).
* Ensure stability and security of digital workplace technology through effective endpoint management and timely patching.
* Establish computing configuration and operating standards in coordination with IT colleagues.
* Execute digital workplace technology projects.
* Actively participate in resolving high-priority outages, troubleshooting efforts, and capacity/availability planning sessions.
* Support security operations processes by monitoring and reporting anomalies related to devices and identities.
* Monitor technology trends and seek ways to enhance continuous improvement initiatives. Assess criticality of services and applications and automate testing of those deemed critical before patching and upgrades.
* Additional responsibilities in the Collaboration space is also included.


What you bring to the table… (Must Have)* Proficiency with SharePoint, Teams, Power Platform and other Microsoft 365 products as well as PowerShell.
* Strong computer skills including mastery of SharePoint & Power Platform a must.
* Hands-on experience in Teams, SharePoint, Power Platform development using tools like SharePoint Designer, Power Apps, Power Automate
* Knowledge of SharePoint integration with other Microsoft 365 applications (such as Teams, Power Platform, Sharepoint) and third-party systems.
* Understanding of Teams, SharePoint & Power Platform governance, compliance, and information architecture principles.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot related issues.
* Minimum of 5 years supporting Microsoft 365 SharePoint & Power Platform environments.
* Strong Powershell scripting experience a must.
* Minimum of 5 years’ engineering experience working/hands on custom Sharepoint & Power Platform development and Environmental maintenance.
* Experience with configuration management, identity and access management, active directory, collaboration platforms and other cloud-based services
* Deep knowledge of Microsoft Active Directory Azure, and Microsoft Identities.
* Exceptional understanding of Microsoft 365.
* Exceptional understand of administration of Sharepoint, Teams and Power Platform within O365.


Education* Bachelor’s Degree preferred.


It would be great if you have… (Nice to Have)* .NET and Visual Basic skills not required but would be a plus.
* Experience with continuous engineering or other agile methods to keep pace with frequent changes and to reduce complexity.
* Working knowledge of using automation to drive continuous improvement.
* Working knowledge of how machine learning (ML) can enhance automation.
* Excellent written skills
* Foundation in systems automation, change management, capacity planning and documentation.
* Ability to work on one or more initiatives.
* Experience creating scripts and modifying configurations.
* Working knowledge of Digital Workplace tool management: management tools, techniques, monitoring, and integration
* Working knowledge of SPFx, visual studio code


#remote

The target base salary range for this full-time, salaried position is between
$85,900-$140,800
Individual base pay depends on work location and additional factors such as experience, job-related skills, and relevant education or training. Total pay may include other forms of compensation. In addition, we offer competitive health, dental, 401k and wellness benefits beginning on the first day of employment. In that regard, U.S. applicants and employees are protected from discrimination based on certain categories protected by Federal law.

title: Sr Cloud Administrator - Work MST/PST Hours - Remote
description:
SitusAMC is where the best and most passionate people come to transform our client’s businesses and their own careers. Whether you’re a real estate veteran, a passionate technologist, or looking to get your start, join us as we work together to realize opportunities for everyone, we proudly serve.
  
  

At SitusAMC, we are looking to match your unique experience with one of our amazing careers, so that we can help you realize your potential and career growth within the Real Estate Industry. If you are someone who can be yourself, advocate for others, stay nimble, dream big, own every outcome, and think global but act local – come join our team!
  
  

**Position Overview:**  

This role is responsible for the management, maintenance, and support of cloud computing applications. This role will determine technological needs and suggest solutions that meet them. This role will operate cloud infrastructure services and aid cloud deployments and collaborate with development teams and other personnel to establish requirements for new or modified infrastructure services. Cloud Administrators help debug cloud stacks. This role will collaborate with engineering and development teams to evaluate and deploy optimal solutions.
  
  

**Essential Job Functions:**  

Repair and recover from hardware, software, and process failures
  
  

Provide backup and recovery support and guidance for cloud resources
  
  

Assist in planning and coordinating technical deliverables
  
  

Execute unit tests and unit test plans
  
  

Produce data-based reports on technology risk for senior management
  
  

Develop infrastructure documentation and technology mappings in compliance with SOPs
  
  

Monitor progress by maintaining dialogue on work and results
  
  

Installing, configuring, and monitoring tools to support operations
  
  

Work closely with Cloud Engineers to execute automated CI/CD pipelines
  
  

Perform audit checks for security, process, and resource compliance
  
  

Continuously improve patterns, practices, and operational efficiency within the team
  
  

Contribute to training and customer support activities as needed
  
  

Communicate fluently with business stakeholders, product managers, researchers, and developers
  
  

Provide recommendations and technology-based solutions to business requirements
  
  

Provide 1st, 2nd, and 3rd level support to Service Desk and other staff
  
  

Troubleshoots problems, answer hardware and software questions and provide general technical assistance to the firm
  
  

Assist in the documentation of server systems, operational procedures, topology, and hardware/software inventory
  
  

Maintain a good working knowledge of all firm infrastructure and applications services
  
  

Maintain asset records
  
  

Document problem resolutions into the appropriate systems
  
  

Troubleshoot, analyze, and resolve system and user problems
  
  

Plan, organize, and coordinate work assignments and prioritize workload
  
  

Provide backup coverage for other Cloud Administrators when needed
  
  

Rapidly deploy fixes to systems in response to newly identified stability and security threats
  
  

Knowledge and understanding of ITIL and SRE
  
  

Other activities as may be assigned by your manager
  
  

**Qualifications/ Requirements:**  

Associate degree in related field or equivalent combination of education and experience
  
  

Experienced professional with 5+ years of industry and/or relevant experience, typically at a Senior Analyst or Analyst level role or external equivalent.
  
  

Fluent in Python, Powershell, and a variety of programming languages, software, and systems.
  
  

Strong computing and scripting skills
  
  

Comfortable with Agile practices
  
  

Able to work in an environment using cloud systems
  
  

Familiar with SaaS processes and products
  
  

Experience leading projects
  
  

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and professional appearance
  
  

Knowledge of daily Windows server administration, including system stability, integrity, and troubleshooting
  
  

Proficiency in backup integrity and recovery coordination along with disaster preparedness planning
  
  

Self-motivated, with the ability to work in both a team environment and individually
  
  

Knowledge of the relevant computer systems, applications, and equipment to provide customer support of technical terminology, concepts, and applications
  
  

Ability to understand and comply with the relevant department and/or corporate policies, procedures, and guidelines as they pertain to customer support
  
  

Knowledge of relevant commonly-used concepts, best practices, and procedures
  
  

Knowledge of local and remote computer system diagnostic tools
  
  

Strong communication (oral, technical, and written) skills
  
  

Strong analytical ability, good judgment, strategic and multidimensional thinker
  
  

Problem solves using interpersonal relations and diplomacy skills
  
  

Detail oriented and organized
  
  

Strong commitment and dedication to the position and a team player
  
  

**Special Requirements:**  

The employee may be required to report to a different local office as a normal, contemplated, and mandated incident of their employment
  
  

Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds
  
  

Travel up to 25%
  
  

**Working Conditions:**  

Office environment with frequent computer, mouse, keyboard use
  
  

Alternating between sitting or standing as needed
  
  

Hearing, talking, reaching, grasping
  
  

#LI-AS1 #LI-REMOTE
  
  

**Note:** This job description is not intended to be all inclusive or exclusive. At any time, employees may perform other related duties as required to meet the ongoing needs of the organization and participate in additional trainings.
  
  

SitusAMC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.
  
  

Know Your Rights, Workplace Discrimination is Illegal
  
  

SitusAMC does not accept unsolicited resumes from staffing agencies, search firms or any third parties. Any unsolicited resume submitted to SitusAMC in any manner will be considered SitusAMC property, and SitusAMC will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.
  
  

**Job Location:**  

Remote, RE, USA
  
  

**Country:**  

USA
  
  

The annual full time base salary range for this role is ($90,000 - $140,000). Specific compensation is determined through interviews and a review of relevant education, experience, training, skills, geographic location and alignment with market data. Additionally, certain positions may be eligible to receive a discretionary bonus as determined by bonus program guidelines, position eligibility and SitusAMC Senior Management approval. SitusAMC offers PTO and paid holidays, the terms of which are set forth in the program policies. All full time employees also are eligible to participate in various benefit plans, including medical, dental, vision, life, disability insurance and 401K; in each case in accordance with the terms of the applicable plans.

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
Bitwarden empowers enterprises, developers, and individuals to securely store and share sensitive data. With a transparent, open-source approach to password management, secrets management, and passwordless and passkey innovations, Bitwarden makes it easy for users to extend robust security practices across all online activities. Founded in 2016 with headquarters in Santa Barbara, California, Bitwarden is supported by a passionate global community of security experts and enthusiasts.



Bitwarden truly cares and wants all Bitwarden users to have the best experience while accessing their sensitive information. The Solutions Engineering team works closely with the Integration Engineering and Sales teams to help users and all Bitwarden prospective customers meaningfully engage with Bitwarden products. The goal remains for all users to ultimately achieve their desired outcome and gain the knowledge and skills necessary for consideration of acquisition and production implementations. Team members have excellent product knowledge, superb technical skills, stellar grammar, attention to detail, and the ability to explain complicated things simply. Success is measured in diligence, precision, transparency, customer assessment and adoption.



Bitwarden seeks a server and cloud enthusiast, with experience in both communicating about and deploying these technologies. You will become a Bitwarden product expert and handle business inquiries regarding our products, provide solutions for technical issues, design systems proof-of-concepts, ensure customer satisfaction, and bridge the gap between confusion and confidence for prospects looking to adopt Bitwarden.


**RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Functioning as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for Bitwarden and the Bitwarden suite of services
* Conduct engaging implementation-specific demos and product technical Q&A
* Attend deal cadence calls with Sales Account Executives to check in on pre-sales proof-of-concept progress and assist in planning and implementation as needed
* Report product feedback and feature requests to Product and Engineering teams
* Assist account executives with positioning new or upcoming product features to customers
* Build scripts, integrations, and examples for customers to test product functionality during pre-sales proof-of-concepts
* Work with the Sales Team to develop account strategies to build, mature and close pipeline
* Track the competitive landscape; provide technical depositioning information to account executives and prospects
* Provide assistance in responding to technical questions on requests for proposals, comments, and information
* Advising customers on industry best practices for the full stack of Bitwarden
* Working with enterprise prospects to solve issues and/or look ahead to identify solutions to situations they may face in the future
* Providing superb guidance and assistance for each business prospect or customer's implementation of Bitwarden, integration with the rest of their technology stack, and general security
* Keep organized notes to champion's feedback in collaborative sessions spanning the Bitwarden team to assist Bitwarden in not just meeting, but exceeding expectations
* Coordinate hand-off to Integration Engineering and Customer Success Engagement Management teams to move customer environments from proof-of-concept to production, ensuring product and service continuity


**WHAT YOU BRING TO BITWARDEN**


* Excellent English and grammar
* Excellent problem-solving skills (you might not know all the answers but you know how to find and communicate the solutions)
* Project planning, including collaborative and individual time management
* A passion for supporting your team members, growing together (technical ability and emotional intelligence), and sharing your knowledge with all
* A strong sense of empathy and the ability to advocate for others
* A passion for helping enterprise prospects interested in Bitwarden and best security practices.
* Experience from a previous technical position (e.g. Sales Engineer, Systems Engineer, Integration Engineer, DevOps Engineer, IT Infrastructure Engineer, etc). Equivalent education or demonstrable skills may be accepted
* Ability and desire to work remotely, with possible travel as needed


**Familiarity with several of the following areas/technologies is preferred:**


* Bitwarden
* Linux, Windows, and macOS
* Docker (Swarm Mode), Kubernetes, and Podman
* NFS and CIFS
* Bash and PowerShell
* Active Directory, LDAP, G Suite, Azure AD, Jumpcloud, Cloudflare and Okta
* GCP, AWS, and Azure
* Android and iOS
* GitHub
* NGINX
* SQL
* TCP/IP
* DNS
* HTTP
* SMTP
* SSO implementation and best practices (SAML and OpenID Connect)
* Integrating SCIM solutions
* TLS/SSL and PKI
* RESTful services / API's


**WHAT TO EXPECT IN THE INTERVIEW PROCESS**



Selected candidates will be invited to schedule an introduction call and potentially progress through the following stages:


* Interview with Integration Engineering Manager
* Interview with Sr. Director, Customer Success
* Interview with Chief Sales Officer
* Interview with Chief Customer Officer


**A FEW REASONS TO WORK WITH US**


* Our user community loves us and we love them. Come to work each day with a sense of purpose as we bring a more secure internet experience to everyone from our friends and family to the world's largest organizations.
* Become an expert. You'll get immersed in the prominent technology markets of security and open source software.
* We are dedicated to building a diverse and talented team. Work remotely with motivated and supportive team members across the world and take part in productive and fun meetups.
* Learn and grow. Take on new challenges with the support of your team, and join our #growth-club to continue personal and professional development.


We recognize and understand that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. If you don't meet 100% of the qualifications for the position, you should still consider applying. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and excellence; therefore, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the interview process.


*A note to outside sourcers: We do not accept solicitations from recruiters, recruiting agencies, headhunters, or outsourcing organizations. Please remove us from all such contact lists.*

title: Application Engineering Developer
description:
**Company Description**



At Higher Logic, engagement happens here. As the industry-leading, human-focused engagement platform we deliver powerful online communities and communication tools to organizations looking to build, retain, and grow their member or customer base. We're obsessed with engagement and, with over 13 years of experience in the industry, we've got it down to a science. We are a global company with offices throughout the US, Canada, and Australia. We serve more than 3,000 customers, representing over 350,000 online communities with over 200 million users across 42 countries worldwide.



Our team is a thriving community of authentic people with diverse experiences and perspectives. We are honest and genuine and believe that sharing ideas and feedback openly helps us to be successful. We believe that diversity and empathy bring us #AllTogether to make us stronger. We learn from failure and successes because both help us to grow and learn. We strive to understand the why behind our actions and bring our best selves to work every day.


**Job Description**



The Application Engineering Developer I/II provides technical support to our Customer Services and Support teams by troubleshooting our software services, providing solutions, and detecting application bugs. The Application Engineering Developer also provides support to the Operations, Development, and Platform/DevOps teams in managing and troubleshooting our software services in both physical and cloud-based environments. Application Engineering Developers are the first to respond to problems in the system. If unable to solve the problem, they alert and escalate to the appropriate team(s).


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITES:


* Focus on customer reported issues escalated by Customer Services teams; troubleshooting, performing basic code analysis, triaging, and/or writing SQL database queries to isolate issues and provide resolution; escalating to appropriate team as necessary.


* Take ownership of assigned tasks, following through on assignments until issues are resolved and closed.


* Develop proficiency in product knowledge, working towards subject matter expertise.


* Learn necessary IT tools and issue management tools to work through issues, along with processes defined for Service Level Agreements, bug escalation, and team procedures.


* Work with senior team members in investigating complex issues, determining root cause, and working issues toward resolution.


* Build, develop and grow cross-functional relationships; actively and collaboratively engage via internal communication channels, providing timely feedback on questions.


* Assist in monitoring system resources and application issues, escalating to appropriate team as necessary.


* Update documentation as necessary.


* May, infrequently, be requested to work an on-call shift, including nights, weekends, and holidays, as necessary.


* Conduct all business in accordance with Higher Logic policies and procedures.


* All other duties as assigned.



KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:


* Basic knowledge of database structure, SQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Object Oriented programming.


* Passion for problem solving and desire to learn.


* Time Management: Attends to a broader range of activities; uses time effectively and efficiently; concentrates on the more important priorities.


* Self-Starter: Works with moderate/limited supervision, engaging team members for assistance as needed.


* Adaptability: Flexible and quickly adjusts to changing priorities, responsibilities, assignments, expectations, and processes.


* Communication: Listens effectively; conveys information accurately and comprehensively; actively seeks feedback.


* Customer Focus: Understands and meets the needs of customers, addressing the interests and concerns of all organization stakeholders.


* Approachability: Builds strong work relationships and easily adjusts to how individuals and cross-functional teams work.


* Priority Setting: Quickly senses what will help or hinder accomplishing a goal; eliminates roadblocks and creates focus.


**What you'll earn:**


* Competitive compensation.
* Comprehensive health benefits package.
* Company culture that recognizes its employees.
* Room for growth and development and management that cares about your professional growth and will help you achieve your goals.
* Significant advancement opportunities for outstanding performers.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
**About the Role:**

We are currently hiring a full-stack data scientist. You should know the fundamentals of statistics, data science, and machine learning. You should be able to parse through hard problems and rigorously formulate your thinking mathematically. On top of that, you should be familiar with how every part of an application operates— frontend, backend, DB, IaC, cloud, etc. Not that you should be an expert per se, but a quick-to-learn generalist with a specialized understanding in data science.

* You should be experienced with Python as well as React+NextJS (specifically Typescript)

**Key Responsibilities:**

* *Data Science and Analytics:* Apply statistical methods and machine learning algorithms to analyze complex datasets, aiding in the development and optimization of AI agents.
* *Full Stack Development:* Participate in developing client-side and server-side architecture. Utilize React+NextJS (Typescript) for front-end development and Python for back-end processes.
* *Agent Benchmarking and Testing:* Utilize the AgentOps SDK to rigorously test AI agents for compliance, reliability, and robustness, ensuring high-quality outputs.
* *Problem-Solving:* Tackle complex challenges in AI agent development, formulating solutions with a strong mathematical foundation.
* *Collaboration and Communication:* Work closely with our diverse team, including an ex-MLOps engineering lead and an ex-Amazon engineer, to innovate and advance our AI agent platform.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field.
* Proven experience in data science, with a strong foundation in statistics and machine learning.
* Proficiency in Python and experience with front-end technologies like React+NextJS (specifically Typescript).
* Familiarity with database management, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), and cloud services.
* Quick learner with a generalist skill set and a specialization in data science.
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and a rigorous approach to mathematical formulations.
* Strong communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic team environment.

**Desirable Experience:**

* Previous experience in AI/ML Ops or related fields.
* Contribution to AI agent development or similar projects.
* Experience in a startup environment, especially in a high-growth tech company.

**What We Offer:**

* Opportunity to work in a fast-growing sector with a strong market fit.
* A dynamic and innovative work environment with a talented team.
* Competitive salary and benefits.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.

To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter explaining your fit for this role and any relevant project portfolios or GitHub repositories. Alternatively, please send a video of why you would be great for the role to daniella@supernovatechnology.com

We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer.
